submenu.title: Overview of the Courses
submenu.desc: General information on learning path, licensing, participation.

submenu.title: Basic Cruising Course - Sail Canada Level I
submenu.desc: Sail in familiar waters, in moderate wind and sea conditions by day. 27 hours, mostly on water.

submenu.title: Intermediate Cruising Course - Sail Canada Level II
submenu.desc: Gain skills for extended cruising in coastal waters and for bareboat chartering. 7 days liveaboard.

submenu.title: Basic Coastal Navigation Course - Sail Canada BN
submenu.desc: Plan voyages and safely navigate in coastal and inland waters. 18 classroom hours.

submenu.title: ROC(M) Course - Marine VHF Radio with DSC License
submenu.desc: Canadian Federal government issued license that allows you to operate a marine VHF radio, accepted worldwide. 9 classroom hours.

submenu.title: RYA Courses
submenu.desc: Royal Yachting Association (British) sailing courses are available through our colaboration with Aegeas Yachting, Kavala, an accredited RYA School.

submenu.title: Flotilla 2019
submenu.desc: Sail in Greek waters. Gain experience. Have fun. Make friends.

submenu.title: Beaufort Scale
submenu.desc: Wind speed and sea state scale.
